item.text: Ahab had 70 sons living in Samaria. So Jehu wrote letters and sent them to Samaria to the leading officials of Jezreel and to the guardians of Ahab’s dynasty. This is what the letters said,

“You have <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of your <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>, <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st>, a <st data-num="04013" class="">fortified</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, and <st data-num="05402" class="">weapons</st>. <st data-num="06258" class="">So</st> when <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05612" class="">letter</st> <st data-num="0935 0413">arrives</st>,<n id="1" />
pick the best and most capable of your master’s sons, place him on his father’s throne, and defend your master’s dynasty.”
They were absolutely terrified and said, “Look, two kings could not stop him! How can we?”

So the palace supervisor, the city commissioner, the leaders, and the guardians sent this message to Jehu, “We are your subjects! Whatever you say, we will do. We will not make anyone king. Do what you consider proper.”

He wrote them a second letter, saying, “If you are really on my side and are willing to obey me, then take the heads of your master’s sons and come to me in Jezreel at this time tomorrow.” Now the king had 70 sons, and the prominent men of the city were raising them.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> they <st data-num="0935 0413">received</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">letter</st>, they <st data-num="03947" class="">seized</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> and <st data-num="07819" class="">executed</st> all <st data-num="07657" class="">70</st> of <st data-num="0376" class="">them</st>.<n id="1" /> They <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> their <st data-num="07218" class="">heads</st> in <st data-num="01731" class="">baskets</st> and <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> them <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him in <st data-num="03157" class="">Jezreel</st>.

The <st data-num="04397" class="">messenger</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> and <st data-num="05046 0559">told</st> Jehu,<n id="1" /> “They have <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">heads</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>.” Jehu<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="07760" class="">Stack</st> them in <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="06652" class="">piles</st> at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> of the <st data-num="08179" class="">city gate</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st>.”

In the <st data-num="01961 01242">morning</st> he <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> and <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> there. Then he <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>, “<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> are <st data-num="06662" class="">innocent</st>. <st data-num="02009 0589">I</st> <st data-num="07194" class="">conspired</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st> and <st data-num="02026" class="">killed</st> him. But <st data-num="04310" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> down <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> of <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> men?
Therefore take note that not one of the Lord’s words which he pronounced against Ahab’s dynasty will fail to materialize. The Lord has done what he announced through his servant Elijah.”
Then Jehu killed all who were left of Ahab’s family in Jezreel, and all his nobles, close friends, and priests. He left no survivors.
Jehu then left there and set out for Samaria. While he was traveling through Beth Eked of the Shepherds,

<st data-num="03058" class="">Jehu</st> <st data-num="04672" class="">encountered</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="0251" class="">relatives</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0274" class="">Ahaziah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>. He <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st>, “<st data-num="04310" class="">Who</st> are <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st>?” They <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="0587" class="">We</st> are <st data-num="0274" class="">Ahaziah’s</st> <st data-num="0251" class="">relatives</st>. We have <st data-num="03381" class="">come down</st> to see <st data-num="07965" class="">how</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> and the <st data-num="01377" class="">queen mother’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">are doing</st>.”
He said, “Capture them alive!” So they captured them alive and then executed all 42 of them by the cistern at Beth Eked. He left no survivors.

When he left there, he met Jehonadab son of Rekab who had been looking for him. Jehu greeted him and asked, “Are you as committed to me as I am to you?” Jehonadab answered, “I am!” Jehu replied, “If so, give me your hand.” So he offered his hand and Jehu pulled him up into the chariot.
Jehu said, “Come with me and see how zealous I am for the Lord’s cause.” So he took him along in his chariot.
He went to Samaria and killed each of Ahab’s remaining family members who were in Samaria until he destroyed them, in keeping with the Lord’s message which he had announced to Elijah.
Jehu assembled all the people and said to them, “Ahab worshiped Baal a little; Jehu will worship him with great devotion.

So <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st>, <st data-num="07121" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05030" class="">prophets</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st>, as well as <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="05647" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0408" class="">None</st> of <st data-num="0376" class="">them</st> must <st data-num="06485" class="">be absent</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> I am offering a <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st> to <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st>. <st data-num="03605" class="">Any</st> of them <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="06485" class="">fails to appear</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">lose</st> his <st data-num="02421" class="">life</st>.” But <st data-num="03058" class="">Jehu</st> was <st data-num="06213 06122">tricking</st> them<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04616" class="">so</st> he could <st data-num="06" class="">destroy</st> the <st data-num="05647" class="">servants</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st>.

Then <st data-num="03058" class="">Jehu</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">ordered</st>, “<st data-num="06942" class="">Make arrangements for</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="06116" class="">celebration</st> for <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st>.” So they <st data-num="07121" class="">announced</st> it.

<st data-num="03058" class="">Jehu</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> invitations <st data-num="03605" class="">throughout</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05647" class="">servants</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st>; <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> was <st data-num="07604 0834 03808 0935">absent</st>. They <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st> at the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st> and <st data-num="04390" class="">filled</st> <st data-num="01004 01168">it</st> <st data-num="04390" class="">up</st> from <st data-num="06310" class="">end</st> to <st data-num="06310" class="">end</st>.<n id="1" />

Jehu <st data-num="0559" class="">ordered</st> the <st data-num="0834" class="">one who</st> was <st data-num="05921" class="">in charge of</st> the <st data-num="04458" class="">wardrobe</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="03318" class="">Bring out</st> <st data-num="03830" class="">robes</st> for <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05647" class="">servants</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st>.” So he <st data-num="03318" class="">brought out</st> <st data-num="04403" class="">robes</st> for them.
Then Jehu and Jehonadab son of Rekab went to the temple of Baal. Jehu said to the servants of Baal, “Make sure there are no servants of the Lord here with you; there must be only servants of Baal.”
They went inside to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had stationed 80 men outside. He had told them, “If any of the men inside gets away, you will pay with your lives!”

When he finished offering the burnt sacrifice, Jehu ordered the royal guard and officers, “Come in and strike them down! Don’t let any escape!” So the royal guard and officers struck them down with the sword and left their bodies lying there. Then they entered the inner sanctuary of the temple of Baal.

They <st data-num="03318" class="">hauled out</st> the <st data-num="04676" class="">sacred pillar</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st> and <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st> it.

They <st data-num="05422" class="">demolished</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04676" class="">sacred pillar</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st> <st data-num="05422" class="">and</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> of <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st>; it is <st data-num="07760" class="">used as</st><n id="3" /> a <st data-num="04163" class="">latrine</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> this very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.
So Jehu eradicated Baal worship from Israel.
However, Jehu did not repudiate the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had encouraged Israel to commit; the golden calves remained in Bethel and Dan.

The Lord said to Jehu, “You have done well. You have accomplished my will and carried out my wishes with regard to Ahab’s dynasty. Therefore four generations of your descendants will rule over Israel.”
But Jehu did not carefully and wholeheartedly obey the law of the Lord God of Israel. He did not repudiate the sins which Jeroboam had encouraged Israel to commit.
In those days the Lord began to reduce the size of Israel’s territory. Hazael attacked their eastern border.
He conquered all the land of Gilead, including the territory of Gad, Reuben, and Manasseh, extending all the way from the Aroer in the Arnon Valley through Gilead to Bashan.
The rest of the events of Jehu’s reign, including all his accomplishments and successes, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Israel.

<st data-num="03058" class="">Jehu</st> <st data-num="07901 05973 01">passed away</st><n id="1" /> and was <st data-num="06912" class="">buried</st> in <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st>.<n id="2" /> His <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03059" class="">Jehoahaz</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">replaced</st> him as <st data-num="04427" class="">king</st>.
Jehu reigned over Israel for 28 years in Samaria.
